P.title: Will any part of Great Britain be under monarchy in 2075?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, on January 1, 2075, at least 1% of the population of Great Britain (the mainland island only) live in a state with a monarch as head of state

not_P.title: Will no part of Great Britain be under monarchy in 2075?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, on January 1, 2075, less than 1% of the population of Great Britain (the mainland island only) live in a state with a monarch as head of state

P.title: Will any part of Great Britain be under monarchy in 2075?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, on January 1, 2075, at least 1% of the population of Great Britain (the mainland island only) live in a state with a monarch as head of state

metadata.background_info:
As of February 2021, the island of Great Britain is part of the UK, which is a constitutional monarchy. Although the monarch once held power, over time this has diminished so that their role of head of state is 'broadly ceremonial'.
The English Civil War resulted in the trial and execution of the king in 1649, and the declaration of a republic, which lasted until the English monarchy was restored in 1660.
Globally, the number of monarchies has decreased from over 150 in 1900 to 44 in 2019 (graph).
A 2020 YouGov poll of British adults found that 62% were in favour of retaining the monarchy, with 22% opposed.

P.title: Will Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed experience a significant leadership disruption before 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
A "significant leadership disruption" includes confirmed reports that Abiy has:
resigned (including the issuance of a resignation that will take effect at a later date),
lost a confidence vote,
lost an election,
formally left office,
died,
been forcibly removed from office for 10 or more consecutive days,
fled or been exiled from office for 10 or more consecutive days,
been medically incapacitated from discharging their duties for 10 or more consecutive days,
been missing (whereabouts unknown) for 10 or more consecutive days.
Resolution will be according to reliable published reports

not_P.title: Will Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed not experience a significant leadership disruption before 2025?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
A "significant leadership disruption" includes confirmed reports that Abiy has:
not resigned (including the issuance of a resignation that will not take effect at a later date),
not lost a confidence vote,
not lost an election,
not formally left office,
not died,
not been forcibly removed from office for 10 or more consecutive days,
not fled or been exiled from office for 10 or more consecutive days,
not been medically incapacitated from discharging their duties for 10 or more consecutive days,
not been missing (whereabouts unknown) for 10 or more consecutive days.
Resolution will be according to reliable published reports

P.title: Will Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed experience a significant leadership disruption before 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
A "significant leadership disruption" includes confirmed reports that Abiy has:
resigned (including the issuance of a resignation that will take effect at a later date),
lost a confidence vote,
lost an election,
formally left office,
died,
been forcibly removed from office for 10 or more consecutive days,
fled or been exiled from office for 10 or more consecutive days,
been medically incapacitated from discharging their duties for 10 or more consecutive days,
been missing (whereabouts unknown) for 10 or more consecutive days.
Resolution will be according to reliable published reports

metadata.background_info: Abiy Ahmed Ali has been Prime Minister of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia since 2018, and in 2021 he was re-elected with a huge majority to a five-year term. But he faces a spiraling civil war centered on Tigray Region, which is battering his economy and leading to increasing international pressure.

P.title: Will the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints allow same-sex marriage by 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, otherwise known as the Mormons, have historically been more anti-LGBT, in terms of both official church doctrine and the individual attitudes of members, than most major Christian denominations in America. However, like other such large, socially conservative churches, there has been a lot of pressure recently, particularly from younger and/or LGBT members, for them to change their doctrine regarding gender and sexuality.
Will the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints officially recognize marriages between individuals of the same sex?
This question resolves positively if by midnight on December 31st, 2029, the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints officially recognizes marriages between individuals of the same sex.

not_P.title: Will the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints not allow same-sex marriage by 2030?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, otherwise known as the Mormons, have historically been more anti-LGBT, in terms of both official church doctrine and the individual attitudes of members, than most major Christian denominations in America. However, like other such large, socially conservative churches, there has been a lot of pressure recently, particularly from younger and/or LGBT members, for them to change their doctrine regarding gender and sexuality.
Will the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints not officially recognize marriages between individuals of the same sex?
This question resolves positively if by midnight on December 31st, 2029, the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints does not officially recognize marriages between individuals of the same sex.
